references.reason: This paper provides fast algorithms for solving the lp-regression problem, which is crucial for solving the lp QRJA problem efficiently.

references.paper_title: An homotopy method for lp regression provably beyond self-concordance and in input-sparsity time
references.reason: This paper introduces a homotopy method for solving lp regression, offering a theoretical improvement in running time compared to previous methods.

references.paper_title: Maximum flow and minimum-cost flow in almost-linear time
references.reason: This paper presents almost-linear time algorithms for maximum flow and minimum-cost flow problems, which are leveraged in the paper's almost-linear time algorithm for lp QRJA when p > 1.
This paper introduces the concept of quantitative judgment aggregation (QJA) and provides foundational work in this area, which is directly extended and improved in the current paper.
This paper lays the groundwork for the quantitative relative judgment aggregation (QRJA) problem, introducing the foundational model and solution concepts that are built upon in this research.
